data.title: An Article About Elon Musk's Alleged Drug Use Means More Volatility for Tesla Stock
data.text: The story puts “key man risk” at the EV maker in the spotlight

data.title: Starting 2024 on the Wrong Foot. What Happened to Tesla Last Week?
data.text: Here's everything you need to know about the electric vehicle maker's week.

data.title: Elon Musk Claims “Not Even Trace Amounts” Of Drugs In His System After Report Detailed Drug Concerns From Tesla, SpaceX Execs
data.text: Elon Musk denied using illegal drugs on Sunday, claiming “not even trace quantities” of drugs or alcohol were found in his body over three years of random drug tests, after a report in the Wall Street Journal detailed how the Tesla CEO and SpaceX founder's drug use worries colleagues in leadership positions at his companies.

data.title: Why Tesla Could Get Dethroned as the King of EVs in 2024
data.text: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA ) has been the undisputed champion of electric vehicle stocks over the past decade. Indeed, without Tesla, perhaps this industry may not exist in its current fashion.

data.title: Will Elon Musk's Drug Use Hurt Tesla?
data.text: In a long and extremely detailed article, The Wall Street Journal reported that Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) founder Elon Musk has used serious and often illegal drugs.

data.title: Huge News for Tesla Stock Investors
data.text: Tesla's production surpassed 1.8 million units for 2023.

data.title: Tesla board members worried Elon Musk was on drugs when he shot off his infamous 'funding secured' tweet, WSJ reports
data.text: Elon Musk shocked Tesla shareholders in 2018 when he announced he wanted to take the company private.   A new WSJ report revealed that some board members were concerned that he was on drugs when tweeting.

data.title: Elon Musk's drug use was so concerning it prompted a Tesla director to forgo a reelection bid, WSJ reports
data.text: The Wall Street Journal reported executives across Elon Musk's companies worry about his drug use. A former Tesla director didn't seek reelection to the company's board due to his drug use, per The Journal.

data.title: Elon Musk Has Used Illegal Drugs, Worrying Leaders at Tesla and SpaceX
data.text: Some executives and board members fear the billionaire's use of drugs—including LSD, cocaine, ecstasy, mushrooms and ketamine—could harm his companies.

data.title: BYD vs Tesla: Is Tesla in Trouble?
data.text: Are any investors more frustrated now than Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) shareholders?

data.title: 3 Growth Stocks to Sell in January Before They Crash and Burn
data.text: Growth stocks performed well in 2023. Many stocks rallied as investors felt the optimism and lower inflation readings made people anticipate interest rate reductions in 2024.

data.title: 5 Innovative Stocks That Could Score a Win for Your Portfolio in 2024
data.text: Some of these stocks already have delivered big gains, but still have plenty of room to run. Others, thanks to their game-changing technologies, could see their share prices take off at any moment.

data.title: The Score: Tesla, Xerox, Peloton and More Stocks That Defined the Week
data.text: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week's news.

data.title: Lawmakers Want EV Makers to Stay Out of Union Negotiations. That Would Be Good for EV Stocks, Too.
data.text: After winning an important victory for employees of Detroit's “Big Three” automakers, the United Auto Workers (UAW) union isn't slowing down. The union successfully secured new contracts for workers at Ford (NYSE: F ), General Motors (NYSE: GM ) and Stellantis (NYSE: STLA ).

data.title: Tesla Recalls 1.6 Million Cars Due to Autopilot Crash Risk
data.text: Tesla is recalling 1.6 million cars sold in China due to issues with its Autopilot system. Regulators says there's a higher risk for crashes.

data.title: Tesla recalls 1.6M EVs in China over Autopilot concerns
data.text: Tesla (TSLA) is recalling over 1.6 million of its Models S, X, 3, and Y EVs exported to China over concerns around its Autopilot autonomous driving feature. Yahoo Finance anchors Seana Smith and Myles Udland discuss Tesla's EV competition in the Chinese market while monitoring Tesla shares in Friday's pre-market trading session.

data.title: Tesla Recalls More Than 1.6 Million Vehicles in China
data.text: Electric vehicle maker Tesla (TSLA) is recalling 1.62 million vehicles in China, its second-largest market, over issues with its Autopilot driver-assistance system, according to China's State Administration for Market Regulations.

data.title: Tesla recalls 1.6m cars in China over Autopilot and steering defects
data.text: Recall reportedly affects majority of cars firm has sold in China and follows recall of more than 2m Teslas in the US last month

data.title: Tesla recalls more than 1.6 million cars in China over problems with Autopilot, locks
data.text: Tesla is recalling more than 1.6 million vehicles in China, state regulators announced Friday.

data.title: Tesla Model Y UK's best-selling BEV for second year running
data.text: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA)'s Model Y claimed the title as the most-sold battery electric vehicle (EV) in the UK for the second year running, Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT) data revealed on Friday. Some 35,899 models of the car were sold in the UK over the year, marginally up on 35,551 in 2022, placing it above models by the likes of MG, Audi and Polstar.
